variants.Description in input context: c.1139G>A (p.G380E) in PINK1 associated with autosomal recessive Parkinson's disease
c.655C>T (p.R219W) in PARK2 linked to early-onset Parkinson's disease

Material used.Material Name: HEK293 cells overexpressing PINK1 or PARK2 variants
Material used.Description: Mitochondrial respiration was measured in HEK293 cells expressing mutant PINK1 (p.G380E) or PARK2 (p.R219W) using a Seahorse XF Analyzer.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant PINK1 (p.G380E) showed reduced mitochondrial complex I activity (40% of wild-type control).
PARK2 mutant (p.R219W) exhibited impaired mitophagy (50% reduction in LC3-II puncta compared to wild-type).

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across three independent cell passages.

Technical replicates.Description: Each biological replicate was analyzed in duplicate using the Seahorse XF Analyzer.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1/PARK2-expressing HEK293 cells served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected HEK293 cells served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test (p < 0.05).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial respiration â‰¤ 60% of wild-type control
